intro: Torenia latibracteata subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the narrow-bracted torenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tubular, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the family Linderniaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The subspecies parviflora is distinguished by its smaller flowers compared to the typical form of T. latibracteata.
